instruction: How were the machine learning feature selection methods utilized to select the optimal bands for the nutrient regression models in the related study to identify the optimal sets of spectral bands for monitoring multiple grapevine nutrients in vineyards?

These methods were applied to the spectral data obtained from the grapevine canopies using unmanned aerial systems (UAS) and push-broom imaging spectrometers. The purpose of using these feature selection methods was to identify the most relevant and informative spectral bands for predicting the nutrient contents of the grapevines. The ensemble feature ranking method produced similar regression results as the standard PLSR feature selection and regression methods, while generally selecting fewer wavelengths. This approach showed promise in identifying stable sets of wavelengths for assessing grapevine nutrient contents from canopy spectra.
